according multitude idol third point naturall man ready forsake renounce truth hath seeme haue beene best grounded haue receiued greatest comfort becomes occasion losse trouble world peace prosperity last may seeme like gospell euery truth well man cannot professe without interrupting peace ready renounce see proofe hearer word resembled stony ground mat heareth word anon ioy receiueth tribulation persecution ariseth word offended rich man seemed time full zeale deuotion towards christ mar apostle saith enemy crosse christ mind earthly thing therefore belly god end damnation philip teach v iudge others make profession religion shew loue word praise god thou seest lewd use soeuer haue beene hope best fret like worse assembly religion pharisee christ publican resorted luke yet build much twentieth iuly remaineth come second branch apostle exhortation haue already heard bound holy feare least time fall sinne detestation beare vnto shunne occasion prouocations might draw v vse good appointed preserue sinne therefore christ chargeth disciple watch pray temptation matth esay made note man hath sound heart may haue boldnesse god stop eare hearing bloud hearing might prouoke shed doth neglect meanes grace doth doe say euery one hath tentations sin must need wicked man place condition life god hath called men vnto wherein haue fewer meanes grace stronger tentations euill haue calling faithfull haue promise god preserue tentations incident lawfull calling cannot auoid vnlesse would forsake calling psalm hee shall giue angel charge ouer thee keepe thee thy way seeme neuer dangerous full tentation shall beare thee hand thou hurt thy foot stone pro way lord strength vpright man man whose heart vpright shall finde strength enough euery tentation lord way chron wee hee bee assurance preserued iust god leaue themselues may fall fearefull sinnes see two notable example salomon presumed wise learned corrupted religion wiues would abled conuert rather make good woman see god forsooke strangely fell king wiues turned heart god peter presumed loue christ though men offended yet would neuer offended matth much though christ foretold would deny thrice could beleeue verse haue cor vnmarryed careth thing lord hee may please lord verse marryed careth thing world god hath giuen best naturall part best wit best memory vnto requireth knowledge others speech christ generall three seuerall point euery one bound seeke knowledge truth tim god would haue men sort bee saued come knowledge truth though lord infinite mercy yet haue comfort mercy haue knowledge esay people deliuered vnto saint iude respect whole time since christ ascension called also end world cor last time tim act pet ioh effect fruit reacheth body outward man could make holy concerning conscience seruice heb could make commers thereunto perfect sanctified onely touching purifying flesh heb therefore called gal weake beggarly element whereas seruice god vnder gospell worketh wholly manner vpon conscience inward man kingdome god true religion sincere profession word power cor word preached heard sacrament administred receiued prayer vsed ought worke vpon conscience vpon outward man onely therefore called cor ministration spirit called carnall worship pleasing naturall carnall man hee make great conscience delight much respect also apostle saith gal seruice fit god people child sauiour obserues pharisee haue beene precise obseruation ceremoniall law haue made much conscience morall paid tithe mint annise commin omitted weightier matter law iudgement mercy fidelity matth lord prophet ioy earnest desire draw neighbour could neither speake tarry longer away shee goeth city telleth neighbour leaue paile behind surely though came well purpose fetch water need vse water worke doe home needfull doe obserued euangelist saith came city said men nonlatin alphabet best translaters reade men place neighbour among liued without difference sought draw vnto christ hauing thus opened meaning verse let v obserue two point instruction zeale run fetch neighbour leauing paile behind first holy ghost hath obserued woman soone knew beleeued christ zealous draw neighbour sake shee content leaue christ though doubt desired much continue depriue selfe comfort benefit might haue found tarryed longer made hast fetch feare gone could bring called shee saith men one well another without speciall respect neglect others thus woman poore simple woman haue doctrine learne euery one truely knoweth christ findeth comfort carefull ready draw others doct haue found comfort cannot choose speake others heart would burst speake god grace like fire bone ier cannot hide though christ charged two blind men cured say nothing matth yet departed could liues conceale apostle requireth haue receiued wealth world tim euery one doe hath receiued heauenly rich god grace doe good others ready distribute communicate others paul wished heartily agrippa heard altogether excepting bond act grace vnlike worldly conuersion ier one city two tribe greatest part farre neuer better matth many called chosen simple rude people wont finde blessing meanes attaine great measure knowledge grace whereas others better nature capacity education enioying meanes feele sweetnesse power giue thee thankes father lord heauen earth saith sauiour matthew thou hast hidden thing wise prudent reuealed vnto habes haue beene seruant yet gouernement blessed farre aboue moses people much better time beene dayes moses insomuch age giues testimonie iosh stucke fast lord euen day many conuerted ministry apostle christ himselfe yea many despised himselfe preached ministry conuerted iohn yee haue lift vp sonne man shall yee know yea shall finde god hath beene wont prepare seruants hath intended greatest good church making see weake insufficient haue beene bringing base conceit themselues dealt moses exod esay esay ieremy chap paul cor cor would know reason god giues meanes denyeth reason others worthy blesseth meanes others vseth worke weake meanes oft stronger surely reason glory might appeare doth saue haue meanes grace profit haue god mercy much magnified conuersion elect lord vse worke strong meanes onely glory worke would ascribed meanes vnto whereas whole praise redounds lord himselfe cor excellency power god v matth mouth babe suckling thou hast perfected praise perswade men want meanes seeke god yea perswade v haue meanes pray want use meanes cannot feele owne want pray themselues hope god saue men without meanes rom beleeue vnlesse heare lord onely withholdeth meanes onely must giue meanes whoeuer instrument matth lord haruest must send forth labourer haruest doth withhold meanes hath respect care saluation act time ignorance god regarded men perswaded would liue vnder dumbe ministry themselues yea would pitty doe persuade enioy mean yea best meanes rest thinke sufficient frequent meanes seeke earnestly god come blessing carry themselues reuerence deuotion vse meanes may approoue themselues best ministry shall neuer doe thee good vnlesse lord worke water bethesda though vertue heale infirmity yet cured none vntill lord sent angell stirre water iohn though ministry word haue great vertue able saue soules iam yet conuert none vnlesse lord worke cor neither planteth thing hee watereth god giueth increase doe thee good doe thee hurt cor sauour death sauour life true cause thou hast heard thou profitest lord fauoureth thee lord hath respect vnto thee lord loueth shall profit meanes yea weake meanes thou hast enioyed great excellent meanes long time canst profit consider true cause iohn yee therefore heare profitably heard ye god men perswaded would troubled great vnprofitablenesse would earnest god blessing vpon ordinance admonish christian despise ministry meanest workes present necessity true cause sabbath seemes v long day aboue surely take delight workes duty doe call sabbath delight ought doe esay second vse haue heard second property zeale serueth vnto exhort god seruants striue vncheerefulnesse much subiect vnto labour serue god ioy gladnesse heart say vnto thy soule dauid psal art thou heauy soule art thou disquieted within know thou euen thou hast cause humbled deiected thy selfe affliction either outward inward yet euen thou art bound striue thy vncheerefulnesse thou goest doe seruice vnto god euen thy trembling thou shouldest reioyce psal consider thy selfe great reason thou hast doe seruice pleaseth god well people doe performe cheerefully ioy deut thou seruedst lord thy god ioyfulnesse gladnesse heart abundance thing therefore thou shalt serue thine enemy lord shall send thee lord strict seuere reiect seruice good heart doe vnto infirmity failing doth discerne delight notwithstanding let heare thy voice sweet thy voice cant iust cause encouragement feare god onely doe seruice vnto doe cheerefully gladnesse heart saith dauid psal come thy house multitude thy mercy thou lord shouldst marke iniquity lord stand forgiuenesse thee thou maist feared thou hast cause doubt soundnesse thy heart thou canst finde sweetnesse comfort god word worship godly vprighthearted oft noted word god sweeter hony hony combe psalme reioyced zeale obserued example blessed sauiour hath true zeale reioyceth zeale forwardnesse others heard one cause made sauiour forget hunger thirst time euen ioy conceiued foreseeing readinesse forwardnesse samaritanes comming vnto motion perswasion woman plainely expresseth speech vsed disciple verse lift vp eye looke region white already vnto haruest see truth confirmed example others god seruants fiue degree haue ioyed greatly grace haue seene others thus apostle iohn iohn reioyced greatly found thy child walking truth iohn haue greater ioy heare sonnes walke verity haue held themselues bound giue hearty thankes god euen themselues receiued great benefit thus paul ephes heard faith loue hee ceased giue thankes like shall finde phil philemon yea professeth thess affected ioy knew sufficiently thankefull vnto god great affliction good tidings timothy brought piety found among thessalonian euen comfort reuiue thess yea aboue grace haue discerned others haue reioyced praised god haue seene men zealous forward dauid professeth saint excell grace delighted psal paul said siluanus timothy ought alwaies praise god thessalonian giueth reason faith grow exceedingly thess haue beene wont reioyce onely grace haue discerned haue beene conuerted owne ministry might grow selfeloue good know haue done ministry best defence wicked men sathan owne conscience cor good haue done grace men haue receiued ministry greater shall reward imploying pound gained vnto master fiue pound made ruler ouer fiue city luke gained ten ouer ten city luke apostle professeth thessalonian god ministry hope ioy crowne reioycing euen presence christ thess haue reioyced thus grace haue seene heard others paul doth grace romanes rom colossian col yea haue done thus themselues iudgement flesh bloud haue become loosers forwardnesse zeale others could choose tend sort owne disgrace yet haue reioyced notable tryall zeale moses beene onely prophet man fame god church seeth eldad medad obscure men receiue spirit himselfe prophesy well himselfe haue euery whit good gift likely well thought church himselfe better neuer whit discontented though ioshua enuyed himselfe prouoked doe reioyced checked ioshua wished lord people prophet well numb carnall professour matter great discontentment seeth lewd become forward religion himselfe hath professed gospell many yeares seeth young newly crept shell forward himselfe nothing fretted wicked iewes much heard paul say calling god preach gentile cryed away fellow earth fit hee liue act vexed elder brother prodigall sonne luke chiefe priest scribe saw child zealous heard cry hosanna sonne dauid disdained matth quite contrary disposition truely feare god count disparagement see young soeuer wicked soeuer haue beene become forward goodnesse themselues beene wont reioyce see others forward themselues yea though haue beene inferiours see dauid glad people prouoked vnto forwardnesse said vnto let v goe house lord psal iohn baptist saw hearer grow forward zealous ministry would content left went christ yet saw went forward went christ neuer troubled neuer rated though prouoked little iealous credit ioh reioyced verse saith fulfilled ioy vse durable yeeldeth farre greater profit comfort owner whosoeuer reapeth lord corne gaineth soules god shall sure receiue good wage gathereth fruit vnto eternall life fruit labour grace ministry wrought heart men shall neuer perish endure vnto euerlasting life therefore saith shame take paine doe worke dililigently carefully haruestman encouraged worke toile labour chearefully knowes haruest done shall haue mirth ioy fellow seruants shall merry together onely haue reaped euen sowe corne haue reaped shall reioyce well plentifull haruest shall discerne paine labour tooke lost hath prospered well custome making merry reioycing haruest shall finde hath beene ancient esay haue reioyced thee according ioy haruest yea lord hath commanded enioyned people publike solemne reioycing ordained feast tabernacle time kept end deut thou shalt obserue feast tabernacle seuen dayes thou hast gathered thy corne thy wine thou shalt reioyce feast thou thy sonne thy daughter thy seruant verse thou shalt case bee glad saith sauiour disciple haruestman haue great encouragement labour respect may haue worke done shall haue great vnspeakcable ioy yea shall encrease ioy prophet haue laboured worke lord sowed shall reape shall meet make merry together thus haue shewed meaning purpose sauiour word principall doctrine holy ghost intendeth teach v faithfull minister laboureth win soules god shall sure well rewarded ill soeuer vnthankfull world reward doct god certainely reward proofe doctrine obserue two point first euen life worke lord hath care prouide well liberally may want nothing worke beginning grace shew themselues come besought would tarry loue reuerent respect vnto might giue entertainment desire make vse instructed first two respect obserued would haue beene vnwilling giue entertainement though desired samaritan refused receiue giue lodging luke yea haue performed far lesse kindnesse may see verse woman yee know refused giue little water quench thirst begin beleeue beseech earnestly abide shew kindnesse respect vnto though knew hereby expose themselues hatred neighbour beleeued prophet yet perswaded fully seemeth verse messias commended holy ghost approued christ teacheth v property haue receiued true beginning grace loue glad shew kindnesse vnto prophet minister doct god true seruants god age haue declared foure point conuersion proudest contemners ministry haue conuersion euer bin wont shew great reuerence respect vnto see naaman syrian little rage prophet king soone euer miraculous cure brought true god traine came stood reuerently would faine haue shewed reall kindnesse bounty vnto ver see also peter conuerted little mocked apostle counted better men drunke act presently vpon conuersion come speake reuerently vnto seeke comfort ver yea haue bin apt exceede way know cornelius fell downe peter feete worshipped act haue euer borne louing kinde affection vnto tooke leaue disciple ephesus wept sore fell necke kissed act goe tyre disciple wiues child brought way act philippian loued pastour epaphroditus dearely dangerously sicke rome tooke great care keepe knowledge knew would grieue much heare phil haue shewed great care peace preseruation trouble danger paul would haue aduentured appeasing tumult ephesus haue gone multitude haue spoken disciple besought doe would suffer act disciple ptolemais heard agabus trouble paul endure ierusalem besought many teares earnestly goe thither euen broke heart kindnesse act priscilla aquila saue life laid downe owne neck aduentured owne liues rom haue euer beene ready shew reuerence loue vnto entertaining gladly maintaining ministring vnto necessity shunamite husband know kindnesse shewed elisha entertainement gaue king good woman followed christ found comfort doctrine ministred vnto substance luk lydia conuerted constrained paul fellowes come house abide professeth haue taken signe doubted truth conuersion refused accept kindnesse act iaylor washed wound paul silas gaue kinde entertainement house act galatian thought nothing deare bestow vpon paul though plucking owne eye gal philippian sent reliefe oft paul prison phil reason haue bin two comfort haue receiued men esteeme reason message brought vnto cannot esteeme messenger bringeth haue found comfort doctrine must need esteeme person esteeme highly loue workes sake thess elder specially labour word doctrine worthy double honour tim beautifull foot welcome bring good tidings peace yea speakes vnseparable consequence gospell god giues preacher owne sending rom may thereby helpe truth selfe lord god faithfull seruants haue many discouragement ministry wicked therefore need helpe kindnesse godly toward vse doctrine first minister god people minister vse admonished carry selues ministry may deserue loue respect people god euery ignorant carelesse vnconscionable minister apt vrge doctrine duty respect people owe god minister neuer consider manner minister haue bin god people haue giuen receiue truth well others reiect seeme herein plead selues vn willing learne v euen duty owe v well others count folly pride couetousnesse v teach thing bound teach whole counsell god act remember whatsoeuer corruption may heart deliuering yet part god truth hath corruption word mouth righteousnesse nothing froward peruerse pro minister may teach people respect owe yet neither proud couetous reproofe euery one hath receiued true beginning reproofe grace doth beare reuerence loue god minister surely many take themselues right good christian haue grace many esteeme shew reuerence minister selfe thou forsake leuite long thou liuest vpon earth thou doest thou shalt haue worst thy selfe deut practise god seruants haue euer bin wont keepe proportion betweene blessing god hath giuen outward thing liberality contributing maintenance god seruice since people began bring offering house lord haue enough eate haue left plenty lord hath blessed people left great store people readines pay tithe cannot endure liue plentifully count couetous seeke owne though peaceable manner yea man found almost payeth tithe willingly yet minister hath much right vnto law themselues haue thing possesse would dangerous damnable men fraud violence withhold due minister god man rob god yet yee haue robbed mee yee say wherein haue robbed thee tithe offering yee cursed curse yee haue robbed euen whole nation vse lecture seuentie sixe december iohn iiii xlii second vse doctrine examination tryall confidence assurance seeme haue god fauour vse owne saluation certaine many man hath false peace perswasion god fauour owne saluation cor man may thinke stand doth wicked men god saith ier didst thou still cry vnto thou art father guide youth micah yet leane vpon god say lord among v euill come v yea count beast make doubt wonder see god child full doubt feares conclude thence either haue beene notable hypocrite notorious sinner men else madde franticke one sathan hath ouerthrowne desperation twenty hath ouerthrowne false assurance therefore exhorted examine assurance pro hee trusteth owne heart foole true assurance god fauour comfortable thing false peace assurance one grieuous iudgements befall man esay said stay selues wonder addes bee iudgement wonder lord hath couered spirit slumber hath shut vp eye two better man vexed continuall doubt feares lulled asleepe assurance besides keepes man seeking god hold faile shall haue need iob refuge shall perish hope shall sorrow minde apostle saith true confidence heb cast away confidence hath great recompence reward may say contrary side wicked men cast away confidence shall haue recompence reward therefore giue note whereby may try whether assurance haue god fauour peace finde selues faith presumption time first came vnto assurance haue false assurance haue mother wombe neuer minde neuer troubled feares doubt way faithfull say time spirit bondage themselues wrought much feare soundly humbled came comfortable assurance ordinary way yee haue receiued spirit bondage againe feare yee haue receiued spirit adoption whereby wee cry abba father rom meanes whereby wrought v assurance faithfull haue first wrought ministry word thereby daily increased create fruit lip peace peace esay haue false assurance neuer found comfort word neuer cared nay thing euer interrupt peace seldomer heare quiet minde apoc two prophet vexed dwelt earth ground whereupon assurance founded built assurance haue false peace grounded eyther vpon god temporall blessing ho become rich haue found substance labour shall finde none iniquitie mee sin vpon foure reason doctrine let v come v doctrine good vse v minister use people god v minister doctrine serueth exhort v vse good meanes preserue credit estimation person heart god people bound doe tim let man despise thy youth tit see man despise thee lose reuerence estimation heart god people doctrine good may perceiue doctrine apt people despise v specially haue liued long amongst standeth v vpon necessary god child secondly affliction maketh man seeke god wrought see ruler prosperity helpe selues finde helpe else seldome neuer seeke seriously god seldome pray doe sometimes doe full coldly drowsily great vnwillingnesse tediousnesse corruption euery one v rom none seeketh god notably set forth parable prodigall luke first purse full iollity cared father cared though neuer came verse secondly began necessity claue citizen countrey verse thought yet returning father thirdly came extreamity said verse goe father fruit affliction generall prophet saith esay wrought men lord trouble haue visited thee poured prayer thy chastisement vpon doth dauid also speake cried vnto lord trouble psal repeat often verse ordinary vse men doe two notable example haue one psalme looked right hand beheld none would know refuge failed none cared soule cryed vnto lord said thou art mine hope haue said cryed lord till refuge failed chron tribulation prayed vnto lord god humbled himselfe greatly god father prayed vnto true faithfull oft extremity feeling seeme vnable pray yet spirit euen helpeth maketh able pray rom yea lord greatly delighteth haue people seeke let heare thy voice sweete cant one chiefe end aymeth bringing affliction vpon euen make seeke sue vnto goe returne place till acknowledge offence seeke face affliction seeke early ho third last reason affliction profitable necessary prepares heart vnderstanding obedience word true affliction cannot soundly conuert heart honour proper word god law lord perfect conuerting soule psal yet great helpe man conuersion great another doe ten esay seeing thy iudgements earth inhabitant world shall learne righteousnesse god affliction hath humbled men prepared heart might haue good teacher would profit greatly bee messenger interpreter one among thousand declare vnto man righteousnesse gracious vnto c iob made psalmist say blessed man thou chastenest lord teachest thy law psal dauid speaketh himselfe psal good e haue beene afflicted may learne thy statute though teachable scholler yet learned better could haue done without prosperity like wanton child apt play meate many thing heare cannot vnderstand perswaded beleeue list obey list laugh truth taught v fret rage affliction open eares belong god make v vnderstand perswaded many truth could beleeue iob hee openeth eares men euen correction hee hath sealed perswaded great sin sweare profane sabbath drunken necessity hearing word preached haue taught may say prophet doth esay shall bee onely feare make vnderstand hearing warrant belong god affliction perswade one day make vnderstand truth yea affliction bringeth man cleare certaine experimentall knowledge god truth euer without haue attained vnto chron manasses knew lord god iob haue heard thee hearing eare mine eye seeth thee lecture eightie sixe aprill iohn iiii xlvii remaineth proceed v made doctrine touching profitablenesse affliction time would permit v enter vpon last day willing insist vpon doctrine neuer seasonable thinke day regard generall visitation god eyther hath beene late euery village euery family nay thinke scarce one still haue late afflicted sicknesse either person ruler sonne neare deare vnto ruler himselfe two principall v make doctrine first teacheth v beare affliction secondly profit first man doth beleeue doctrine fully perswaded god elect affliction profitable necessary first beare affliction patiently secondly comfortable cheerefull affliction thirdly euen kisse rod thankfull affliction fourthly farre desiring freed affliction rather desire pray followeth consider fault sauiour thus rebuketh ruler shall finde sinne rebuked infidelity except yee see signes wonder yee beleeue say doe thee good except thou hadst faith neither thou thy nation haue true faith beleeue christ sauiour world samaritan sychar nay worse beleeue obstinate infidelity god hath sufficiently word ministry iohn baptist manifested messiah serue turne beleeue except haue miracle confirme yea haue already many miracle declared selfe euidently sonne god also haue heard serue turne neither vnlesse may see eye yee beleeue nay haue least many seene miracle selues yet serue neither vnlesse may see signes wonder miracle sort many miracle yee beleeue haue reproofe sauiour giues great man foure principall point obserued first infidelity iewes onely sinne christ reproueth alone power restraine yeelding ruler helpe desired besought come downe heale sonne christ returnes answer beleeue haue faith say doe good vnlesse beleeue secondly argument whereby christ conuinceth order restitution haue vniustly gotten become new man therefore giue reason god word may enforce exhortation vpon conscience euery man first reason vncertainty life man may die suddenly certaine man assured lay downe night shall rise morning riseth morning shall euer go bed againe therefore remember thy creatour presently without delay repent seeke assurance fauour put day man knowes may befall morrow iames go saith apostle ye say day morrow goe city continue yeare buy sell get gaine yet ye cannot tell shall morrow life euen vapour confider thy selfe thou maist die suddenly first yeare wherein thou hast heard sundry good men bad sort god hath taken away suddenly giuen one dayes one houres respit prepare themselues assurance hast thou deale better thee salomon speaks thing hath fallen age whereunto sort men well good bad haue subiect eccl neither doth man know time fish taken euill net bird caught snare child men snared euill time fall vpon suddenly euery man euen best may die suddenly carnall wicked man presumptuously put repentance vpon hope god take away suddenly giue space time visitation death doth men hath iust cause feare shall die suddenly god hath oft smitten many men act sinne zimri cozby num elah king israel king king herod also act hath oft threatned vnto vngodly men psal god shoot arrow suddenly stroke shall suddenly destroyed perished vtterly consumed thes shall say peace safetie shall come vpon sudden destruction shall obiect men die suddenly whereas experience shewes one hundred doth answer godly man may said die suddenly feareth alwayes peace god euer prepared death one wicked man hundred dy suddenly though lord giues great space neuer long sicke death yet still ready think shall liue little longer death come vpon looked prepared apostle teacheth thes ye brother darknesse day come vpon thiefe q true belieuer come thiefe euery one darknesse doth second reason may iustly make man affraid put care prouiding saluation soule till euill day man tell long shall enioy meanes grace man meet bridegroome vnlesse haue oyle lampe cannot haue sell mat affliction sicknesse able saue soule without word made prophet say blessed man thou chastenest lord teachest thy law psal nay euery preacher serue turne need rare man good case iob messenger interpreter one thousand need haue tongue learned know minister word time wearie esa assure haue man last sicknes haue esteemed word health may assure themselues haue comforter sicknesse wicked man hath despised ministry word dayes health prosperity hath iust cause feare god depriue comfort sicknesse affliction god hath threatned contemners word amos shall wander sea sea fr north euen east shall run fro seeke word lord shall find ezek destruction commeth shall seeke peace shall haue calamity shall come vpon calamitie shall seek vision prophet law shall perish priest counsell ancient q let euery man make benefit mean grace doth enioy god merchant men among make prouision oyl lamp man sure haue like mean would himselfe cor behold accepted time behold day saluation third reason perswade men reconcile themselues god get assurance saluation presently youth best health though man sure haue good mean instruction conuersion comfort last sicknesse hath yet shall find himselfe vnfit time make benefit sicknesse extreme affliction dull mind make heart heauy yea man shall haue many meanes trouble distract shall able relish sweetnesse best counsaile giuen holiest praiers made day salomon speakes eccl wherein man shall say haue pleasure remember case best god seruants haue beene extreme affliction haue vnable pray haue astonied could speake psal yet thou saist thou wilt pray haue beene vnable relish profit best meanes harkened vnto moses anguish spirit exod yea soules haue refused comfort psal thou saist thou wilt send preacher take counsaile haue beene oppressed burden sinnes dauid saith himselfe time iniquity taken hold vpon able looke vp number haires head therefore heart failed psal thou saiest thou wilt cast thy sin get assurance pardon haue faine spend vpon old stock comfort themselues haue found themselues present calling mind good thing knew former time iob seek recouer comfort way plaine chap dauid likewise spirit ouerwhelmed within heart within desolate remembred dayes old psal haue sowne vnto themselues righteousnesse prophet speaketh ho thy hope comfort shall find thou deferrest sow till time thou shouldst reape foolish man deceiue thine owne heart longer imagine thou shalt better case sicknesse extreme affliction shall come best god child haue whilst thou art health get assurance thy saluation thou wilt vnfit seeke lay vp knowledge time spending thy stock thou hast gotten increasing giue thy selfe much prayer get assurance thou hast spirit prayer thou wilt hardly able fourth reason disswade man putting repentance till sicknesse though sure haue neuer good meanes repentance though sicknesse griefe selfe force hinder profiting yet shall vnable receiue good vnlesse lord pleased worke lord know way man himselfe man walketh direct step ier euery man hath wilfully deferred put time repentance hath iust cause feare god worke meanes doe good first god hath counsell set determined day euery man visitation iust time moment euery man conuersion passe shall neuer conuerted euery man account time come present time god word spirit moue repent day time grace repentance therefore heb foure time repeated day heare voice secondly nature sinne harden heart longer sinne continued harder make heart vnable repent man giues libertie himselfe sinne able say thus far go stay selfe thus long continue repent longer man continues net snare shall intangled difficultie get deceitfulnesse sinne harden heart heb thirdly lord hath threatned punish presumptuous sinner hardnesse heart ezek would haue purged thee thy filthinesse thou wast purged thou shalt purged thy filthinesse till haue caused wrath light vpon thee fifth last reason disswade putting repentance though man sure god would giue good meanes grace euer age last sicknesse also worke effectually vnfained conuersion yet ordinarily haue comfort might haue conuerted sooner first respect cause fountaine whence change doth spring shall haue cause doubt feare repentance proceeds rather seruile feare god iudgements sincere loue god himselfe many know haue seemed affliction penitent whose heart haue proued vnsound slew sought returned enquired early god neuerthelesse flatter mouth lied vnto tongue heart right neither stedfast couenant psal secondly respect fruit repentance singular testimonie euidence sinceritie thereof consequently principall mean comfort bring forth fruit meet repentance saith iohn baptist hearer mat paul great comfort reioycing euen testimonie conscience simplicitie godly sinceritie fleshly wisdome grace god haue conuersation world cor saith great comfort euery man approue truth repentance work conuersation let euery man proue owne worke shall haue reioycing himselfe alone another gal great part comfort depriued die soone haue begun repent thirdly respect lord acceptance shall haue cause doubt fear lest hath bestowed sin satan best time lord refuse accept dreg refuse according ye offer blind sacrifice euill ye offer lame sick euill ye brought torne lame sick thus ye brought offring accept hand saith lord mal lecture obserued two point first shewed diuine power cure euen bodily infirmitie secondly request man weake faith ruler say first obserued sauiour shewed diuine power cure bodily disease first time mention made miracle kind harmony gospell afterward oft spoken consider handle point doctrine text giues v direct occasion obserue sauiour dayes flesh shewed diuine power way much curing body doct men point worthy obserued whereas sauiour sent world doe office chyrurgion physitian body men giue life saluation soules god sent onely begotten sonne end whosoeuer belieues might perish haue life euerlasting iohn name iesus sauiour giuen vnto respect saue people sinnes mat therefore also giues himselfe title physitian expounds himselfe saith physitian body soule physick giue serued cure soule sinne calling men repentance mat yet looke story life shall find one man whose soule cured bringing vnto repentance many whose body helped restored vnto health yea miracle wrought vpon earth done curing body men indeed resurrection ascension declared power wonderfully curing conuerting soules men peter speaketh act god hath raised vp sonne iesus h e hath sent blesse turning euery one iniquity hath god lift vp right hand prince sauiour giue repentance israel forgiuenesse sinnes dayes flesh performe part physitian body rather soule diligently carefully exercise e ng cure vpon body men shall better vnderstand marke sixe point haue obserued cure ou sauiour wrought run ouer fast first person cured refused none came vnto helpe excepted none mat great multitude followed healed yea luke laid hand euery one healed secondly disease themselues cured ague mat palsy mat dropsy luke leprosy luke issue bloud mat blindnesse iohn deafenesse mar dumbnesse matth lamenesse mat lunacy mat word kind disease whatsoeuer refused failed helpe men came vnto helpe mat healed euery sicknesse euery disease among people thirdly obserue time tooke curing men neglected opportunity cured many sabbath dayes luke yea spent himselfe preaching synagogue capernaum vpon sabbath day yet euen come sun downe brought diseased thereabout healed mar yea euangelist luke speaking miracle luke saith laid hand euery one healed fourthly obserue place wherein cure oft time synagogue church assembly matth marke luke fiftly readinesse willingnesse helpe men case onely sought vnto owne accord many time see diseased ready offer help vnto though neuer desired shall find obserued especially cured sabbath day whether feare teacher ruler superstitious conceit themselues entertained sabbath one sought help way vpon sabbath day sought vnto rather offered help vnto luk ioh sixthly lastly obserue affection compassion heart cure euen one himselfe feeling paine misery endure matth moued compassion towards two blinde men touched eye marke iesus compassion put forth hand touched leper marke sighed said vnto ephphata let v come reason moued blessed sauiour thus far reason forth debase himselfe cure disease body men sort finde three principall reason first proue himselfe son god curing disease manner sufficient conuince conscience euery man indeed sonne god iohn done workes among none man sinne doth reason scribe matth yee may know sonne man hath authority vpon earth forgiue sinnes said sicke palsie arise take vp thy bed goe thine house shall obiect argument prophet apostle also miraculous cure vpon manner disease answer true yea apostle greater miracle sauiour according promise iohn hee beleeueth workes doe hee shall doe also yea greater shall doe goe vnto father act god wrought small miracle hand paul body brought vnto sicke kerchiefes handkerchiefes disease departed yea may appeare act shadow peter di ure many yet say though prophet apostle yea greater miracle sauiour yet manner manner neuer euidently proue sonne god two notable difference therefore shall obserue betweene miracle prophet apostle miracle christ first wrought miracle owne name owne power commandement none wont vse earnest prayer doe miracle might declare power whereby worke none owne receiued aboue eliah restoring widow sareptaes childe life king peter restoring tabitha act elder miraculous curing sicke annointing oile iam time vse prayer miracle rather way commanding inuocation yet euer professed owne name owne power onely name iesus act command thee name iesus christ thou come secondly power time could doe miracle whensoeuer would could none apostle though receiued gift cast diuels matth yet could doe time matth paul though maruellous power heale disease euen handkerchiefes carryed body act yet gift time would hee haue suffered epaphroditus haue beene neare vnto death phil second reason christ wrought many miracle curing men bodily infirmity proue himselfe messia sauiour god promised prophet prophet foretold comming messia esay behold god commeth euen god recompence come saue tell next word verse manner miracle doe came whereby know shall eye blinde bee lightened eares dease opened shall lame man hurt punishment man moses miracle egypt elia calling fire heauen destroy two wicked captaines hundred souldiers king peter destruction ananias saphira act paul striking elymas blindnesse act christ instruction seeing one end christ aimed curing helping body men thereby draw seeke helpe soules therefore weale woe body draw v consideration care estate soules first paine misery sin hath brought vpon body grieuous intolerable thinke paine misery thy soule thou seeke helpe pro wounded spirit beare thy soule hath beene fountaine whence sin thy body haue sprung mar within heart men proceed adultery fornication murder thests c thy body hath beene seruant instrument thy soule sin secondly thou finde sweetnesse comfort blessing god hath prouided thy body thinke much sweeter desirable dainty pleasure hath prouided thy soule satisfied good thing house euen holy temple prophet speaketh psal fulnesse ioy pleasure god hath prepared loue euerlasting kingdome thy presence fulnesse ioy thy right hand pleasure euermore psal thirdly thou haue care prouide thy body may kept free misery abound delight sort much carefull shouldst thou prouide thus thy soule seeing first well prouided saued thy body shall sure saued also therefore shall see blessed sauiour death luke steuen also act commend onely soules hand god shew care make mention body secondly euen life welfare thy body depends good estate thy soule ye shall serue lord god shall blesse thy bread thy water take sicknesse away midst thee exod word life finde health flesh pro lecture ninetie seuenth august iohn iiii l infirmity secondly request man weake faith ruler former finished last day remaines proceed latter namely want weakness ruler notwithstanding christ granted request healed childe may better receiue instruction example must obserue three point first great ignorance want faith ruler time craued helpe christ sonne secondly great goodnesse respect christ shewed vnto notwithstanding thirdly reason christ shew respect ignorant weake man first ignorant weake faith shall discerne fiue point first checke reproofe christ gaue verse secondly sought christ helpe till meanes failed childe euen ready dye verse thirdly thought christ could helpe sonne vnlesse went downe verse thought must need either pray annoint touch vse ceremony solemnity else could good seemes naamans minde behold saith thought surely come stand call name lord god strike hand ouer place recouer leper king fourthly thought would purpose christ go son dead ver fifthly lastly rebuked christ infidelity regarded seemes affected troubled affliction sin verse goodnesse respect christ shewed vnto notwithstanding may obserue three point first expostulateth concerning infidelity perceiuing minde oppressed griefe could regard affected said concerning sinne beares saith sinne secondly yeeldeth vnto importunity healeth sonne desired thirdly lastly grant desire could hope hand whereas desired would go downe heale sonne verse would haue required time christ doth immediately deliuer childe paine danger restoreth health reason moued christ shew respect weake man third point told obserued text though chiefly himselfe euen owne mercy shewed mercy pleased doe rom yet doubtlesse respect vnto small seedes beginning faith vprightnesse heart discerned saw first came helpe honest heart perswasion able willing doe good secondly constant importunate would driuen away repulse receiued cause christ great respect vnto notwithstanding fault weakness discerned three point thus obserued text doctrine ariseth instruction lord wont reiect seruants infirmity true lord blinded affection towards child doct cannot see fault doteth vpon delight blemish indulgent towards loth grieue displease many foolish parent first mislikes displeased euen least fault see child hab hath pure eye cannot see euill cannot behold wickednesse see angry reproofes christ hath beene wont giue euen best beloued disciple euen ignorance ye also yet without vnderstanding doe yee yet vnderstand matth weakenesse faith faithlesse peruerse generation long shall long shall suffer matth therefore none hath grace may please himselfe least corruption ought grieued humbled yea child doe slip foule fault hee sharply correct doe amos onely haue knowne family earth therefore visit iniquity see example god seuerity towards moses delaying circumcision son iune lord met sought kill breake forth vpon grieuous iudgement sensible moses zipporah tooke notice cause viz neglect circumcising son exod yea lord sooner beare grosse sinnes others appearance shew euill owne lord god iealous god among deut iealous husband cannot endure much shewes vnchaste loue wife towards another lookes talke gesture secret company therefore nearer man drawes god profession piety religion carefull need looke way mad man imago professour god beare sinnes yet goodnesse lord certainely wonderfull way bearing seruants reiecting infirmity besides none frailty shall imputed vnto condemnation rom seeth iniquity iacob transgression israel num doth passe many foule infirmity child doth much correct life checke make mention surely admirable considering iust lord hate sinne made prophet burst forth admiration micah god like thee taketh away iniquity passeth transgression remnant heritage shall better beleeue considering three point first though lord hate sinne euen owne seruants dislike themselues yet liketh neuer worse frailty iob know shewed great impatiency iob insomuch afterwards considered carryed himselfe saith chapt abhorre selfe repent dust ash god seeth matter god counteth patient man condemned himselfe god iustified ioh twice chargeth friend thus yee haue spoken e thing right like seruant iob like shall see dauid complaineth himselfe psalme sinnes haires head therefore heart failed lord farre better opinion himselfe thus god saith reg followed heart done onely right eye secondly workes wherein seruants haue shewed much frailty hath accepted taken good part hath beene wont reiect good workes haue performed corruption haue shewed chron whereas thine heart build house name saith lord dauid yet ignorantly fondly done purpose thing without warrant god appeareth spake word iudges israel commanded feed people saying haue yee built house cedar chron thou didst well thou wast minded like may see prayer dauid made psal said haste cast thy sight wicked corrupt thought could man haue prayer yet marke followeth yet thou heardest voice prayer cryed vnto thee god reiected prayer though tainted foule corruption speake dauid esay righteousness saith church like filthy clout doth god therefore reiect first accepteth take good part acceptable god iesus christ pet secondly delighteth taketh great pleasure sweet thy voice cant thirdly yea also reward onely life yet godlinesse hath promise euen life tim euen reward inheritance apostle speaketh col dead shall iudged giue reward onely vnto seruants prophet saint feare name small great apoc thirdly lastly farre reiecting seruants infirmity hath care troubled infirmity sheweth tender respect vnto respect pleaseth lord compare himselfe carefull good shepheard sheweth care towards sheepe weak feeble slock esay shall feed flocke like shepheard shall gather lamb arme carry bosome shall guide young ezek seeke lost bring againe driuen away binde vp broken strengthen weake respect said christ mat abruised reede shall breake smoaking flaxe shall quench see experiment two apostle aboue shewed weaknesse faith thomas peter shall finde christ shewed tender respect two rest peter christ carefull resurrection reuealed vnto marke yea cor seene first cephas twelue yea specially giues commandement feed sheepe ioh thomas see care christ iohn first appeared againe disciple hee among sake chiefly secondly single rest giues sensible helpes meanes confirme faith reason doctrine principally two first loue lord beareth person christ gen god respect reas abell offering christ god become father beareth fatherly affection v yea farre tender affection v parent beare little one yea mother may forget haue compassion vpon sonne wombe yet forget thee esay yet euen euill stand thus affected little one cannot loath neglect outbreach looking asquint like deformity yea many thing another man eye great blemish pockeholes face like v seemeth none yea weaker feeble child tender ouer much lord toward child psal father hath compassion child hath lord compassion feare mal spare one spareth owne sonne serueth second reason respect lord hath worke owne spirit dwelleth child vprightnesse heart psal behold thou louest truth inward affection therefore hast thou taught mee wisedome secret heart vprightnesse heart chiefe worke god spirit therefore dauid begs earnestly god would renew right spirit within psal describes man whose iniquity god hath forgiuen bee one whose spirit guile psal god discerneth beare many want though asa many foule fault yet commended asa heart perfect lord day reg side said amazia though many fault asa many thing much better yet lord reiected made account weake asa right sight lord perfect heart chro vse doctrine deliuer must labour preuent use abuse whereas childrens bread many dog whelpes snatching many wicked vngracious man ready abuse doctrine blessing himselfe vngodly way say best haue fault god seuere marke euery thing said done amisse beare infirmity child heart good c say haue nothing doe doctrine first godly haue said none foulest sin shall euer imputed thee say euen least sinne euer thou committedst shall laid thy charge know thou thing god bring thee iudgement eccles euery idle word men shall speake shall giue account day iudgement matth secondly duty godly haue performed euen haue beene full blemish shall accepted rewarded best thing euer thou didst abominable god shall increase thy condemnation sacrifice wicked abomination lord pro thirdly foulest sin euer godly man fell infirmity least offence euer thou committedst reigning sin thou comfortest thy selfe much godlyest haue fault thy sin thine infirmity shew thee sundry difference betweene fault godly thy sin betweene infirmity one reigning sin first committing regenerate man doth commit foule sinne purpose premeditation heart hee ouertaken aware slippeth suddenly violence tentation thus paul describeth sinne regenerate man gal fallen occasion ouertaken fault dauid speakes himselfe psal said haste cast thy presence said haste men lyars purpose desire resolution heart euery regenerate man please god thing esay desire soule thy name remembrance thee see example two fell foulest sin regenerate man reade scripture dauid peter purpose full resolution dauids heart may see psal haue sworne performe keepe thy righteous iudgements fell foule sinne surely suddenly ouertaken passion lust aware fell likewise peter may see full purpose resolution heart matth though men offended thee yet neuer bee offended though die thee yet denie thee fell foule sin surely suddenly ouertaken passion feare aware fell quite contrary vnregenerate man feares sin pro foole rageth carelesse commits sin prepensed purpose determination heart psal imagineth mischiefe bed setteth himselfe vpon way good doth abhor euill rom take thought flesh fulfill lust yea inclination euill nature strong enough draw iniquity cord vanity sinne cart rope esay second difference diuers disposition heart euen time doe sinne regenerate man neuer fall totally sinne commits whole sway soule full consent flesh tempteth draweth sinne spirit resisteth motion drawes another way euen sleepe heart waketh cant iohn hee borne god sinneth neither hee sinne seede god remaineth gal flesh lusteth spirit spirit fl sh contrary one another yee cannot doe thing ye would obeyes sin slaue doth master rom though alwaies felt himselfe yet another spirituall man appeare two note try euen worst grace appeare blow away ash yee shall discerne sparkle grace see dauids readinesse yeeld reproofe nathan confesse sinne euen fallen fearefully lyen long sin sam praying cry god calling affectionately god euen thought passion tentation god forsaken psal thou come poore distressed christian complaines hypocrite vtters many word sauouring nothing infidelity despaire aske whether affraid offend god loue child c cannot deny yet maist thou euidently discerne speaketh falsly himselfe obserue thou shalt finde ioy hath bin haue yeelded temptation made dauid cry make heare ioy gladnesse bone thou hast broken may reioyce psal shall finde two disciple going emaus began doubt wauer made sad heart luke case rebecca felt two twin strugling gen say haue faith grace aske whence come sorrow palenesse losse sleepe c wicked man quite contrary disposition flesh hath resistance himselfe vnlesse first light naturall conscience effect law written heart apostle speaketh romanes secondly repugnancy lust betweene themselues lust war member iames luke thing peace sin willingly heart iohn ye father diuell lust father doe third difference diuers disposition heart haue committed sinne godly wont finde much paine griefe heart much remorse conscience euen smallest sinnes hath committed god see dauid heart smote cutting skirt saul garment giuing commandement numbring people sam sam paul remnant originall sin made cry wretched man c rom sinne infirmity put heart paine bodily infirmity body though dauid lay long sin could recouer himselfe sound repentance yet day committed sin remorse began neuer found true ioy againe till effectually repented psal wicked many foule haynous sin heart quiet iocund example haue iosephs brother conspired slay disswaded stript cote cast pit sate downe eate bread gen another difference diuers disposition heart haue committed sin fourth last difference godly cannot continue sin hath falne riseth againe yea obtaineth strength corruption power forsake sin apt fall againe true regenerate man may fall sinne againe neither man define oft hainous sin man soundly regenerate may fall yet doe finde childe god hath falne oft haynous scandalous sinnes indeed smaller slip concealing wife causing say sister finde abraham taken twice gen foule sinnes shall finde noah neuer drunke dauid committed adultery neither peter returned euer againe apostasie paul persecution repented expresly said iudah truely saw sinne hee knew tamar againe genesis secondly made property christ iesus state grace walke flesh rom verse though cannot kill restraine outward lust yet made able keepe reigning willingly obey lust thereof apostle speaketh rom little little least vnfained desire endeuour heart doe mortifie deed body spirit rom shrewd signe reignes hath body command made apostle say let sin reigne mortall body neither yeeld member instrument vnrightonsnes vnto sin rom side called enemy god psal go sin pet made note gracelesse man cannot cease fin reason plaine vertue christ death neuer separated merit merit effectuall iustification pardon sin vertue effectuall sanctification destroying power sin lord hath sprinkled cleane water vpon v imputation christ suffering righteousnesse made v cleane hath thereby cleansed v filthinesse sinnes also giue v new heart new spirit put v take stony heart v giue v heart flesh ezek speakes peace vnto people saint may turne againe vnto folly psal vnregenerate man continueth walketh sin yea like dropsie man sin may one foule sin shooinghorne draw another lecture ninetie eighth august iohn iiii l hauing last day preuented mistaking abuse remaines proceed v made doctrine principally three first instruction teach v much lord reiects none child infirmity loues esteemes neuerthelesse weakenesse therefore learne despise reiect childe god infirmity therein perfection christian shall appeare euen following striuing like heauenly father matth child resemble disposition ye therefore follower god de child epes v seeme holier god dislike sinner doth grosse hypocrisie iesus walke flesh sam man iudgeth according outward appearance though may well deceiued men heart deceitfull ier yet safe holy errour may say iudgement though erroneous yet iudgement true charity feeles ignorance bewailes measure knowledge soeuer hath attained satisfieth himselfe knowes desire increase knowledge shall see dauid open thou mine eye may behold wondrous thing thy law teach thy able say sinnes know haue left surely haue repented wee sometimes foolish disobedient deceiued seruing diuers lust pleasure liuing malice enuy hatefull hating one another tit man hath vnfainedly repented forsaken sin doubtlesse hath vpright heart thus saith dauid himselfe psal vpright kept selfe mine iniquity hath repented iustified hath sin forgiuen act christ called prince sauiour giue repentance forgiuenes sin yan man shall aske may naturall men forsake leaue sin haue liued answer yes peter speakes temporary hypocrite escaped filthinesse world pet sauiour one vncleane spirit cast house swept garnished matth difference betwixt repentance regenerate naturall man regenerate man forsakes sin conscience god euen knoweth god hath forbidden offended dishonoured sorrow sin according god cor forsaking sin also cor yea forsaking sin growes though yet chiefly knowledge hath god mercy loue beares god goodnesse forsakes euill way returnes lord hope perswasion haue mercy vpon god abundantly pardon esay feares lord goodnesse ho grace god bringeth saluation gospell make knowne v god loue christ hath taught denie vngodlinesse worldly lust tit side hypocrite forsakes sin rather seemes first want meanes follow old secondly occasion offered shew corruption thirdly respect hath credit men fourthly apprehension god wrath regenerate man forsakes one two knowne sin man regenerate say many thing sinne iames meaning though cannot shake euery sin yet knowne sin willingly giueth liberty himselfe small great discouered sin make conscience daniel defiling himselfe king meat dan kept god law conscience obey apple eye least offend pro called precisenesse foolish nicenesse grant indeed note hypocrite precise strict small matter make conscience grosse sin tithe mi cummin neglect weightyer point law streine gnat swallow cammell mat yet shall say least sin tush nothing neuer worse shall well enough doubtlesse man hath soundnes heart iames whosoeuer shall keepe whole law yet faile one point guilty said thou shalt commit adultery said also thou shalt kill least sin committed wilfully presumptuously becomes dangerous damnable soule th ought presumptuously shall cut among
